title: IFDP Paper: Trade Costs and Inflation Dynamics
summary: Pablo Cuba-Borda, Albert Queralto, Ricardo Reyes-Heroles, and Mikaël ScaramucciWe study how trade cost shocks influence inflation. Using bilateral trade flows from detailed global input-output data and a gravity framework, we estimate trade cost shocks and their effects on CPI inflation. Higher trade costs for final goods cause large but short-lived inflation spikes, while increased costs for intermediate inputs trigger more persistent inflation. A multi-country model of inflation with trade in final goods and intermediate inputs replicates these patterns. We show that trade cost shocks and tariffs on imported inputs transmit through global value chains and worsen monetary policy trade-offs. We use the model to quantify the effects of trade costs during the 2018–2019 U.S.-China trade war and to estimate the contribution of trade costs during the post-pandemic inflation surge. Novel data on U.S. domestic sourcing shores allow us to estimate trade cost shocks for the U.S. using Bayesian

title: Parag Parikh Dynamic Asset Allocation Fund: A New Approach to Dynamic Investing
summary: ❌ All dynamic asset allocation funds are equity-focused. ❌ Equity funds are always more tax-friendly. ❌ Higher debt allocation means higher taxes. *These are some of the MANY common misconceptions about Dynamic Asset Allocation Funds.* *The reality?* With smart structuring and strategic optimisation, a Dynamic Asset Allocation Fund can be debt-oriented AND tax-friendly. Introducing the Parag Parikh Dynamic Asset Allocation Fund (PPDAAF) – an open ended dynamic asset allocation fund designed to break the mould! For those desiring a debt-oriented fund with tax-efficiency and measured risk. For those seeking professional management of portfolio with active decision-making, preferring to outsource the task of managing the complexities involved in debt investing. For more information, visit: https://amc.ppfas.com/schemes/parag-parikh-dynamic-asset-allocation-fund/ The asset allocation outlined in the above video reflects the current strategic asset allocation implemented by the Fund Manager

title: Zhang Yongle: Reconfiguring Hegemony
summary: A view from China of the battle for America’s ideological soul, pitting Trump, home-grown nemesis of Western liberal democracy, against Francis Fukuyama, subtlest philosopher of its world-historical triumph. Are these contrasted figures two manifestations of the same hegemonic principle?

title: Roberto Schwarz: Political Polyphonies
summary: Interview with the Brazilian critic and theorist on the literary and political ideas informing his epic play, Queen Lira. A volatile cacophony of voices disputing his country’s path, from Dilma’s impeachment to Bolsonaro’s rise and Lula’s unexpected return.

title: Alyssa Battistoni: Situating Freedom
summary: How might we reimagine freedom on an increasingly turbulent and resource-constrained planet? Charting a course between rival left accounts, Alyssa Battistoni offers a conception inspired by de Beauvoir’s Ethics of Ambiguity: a ‘situated’ freedom, which recognizes natural contingency and centres human agency.

title: Aaron Benanav: Beyond Capitalism—1
summary: In the first instalment of a major contribution to the reconceptualization of a post-capitalist social order, Aaron Benanav marshals insights from a long century of socialist thought and practice—Cabet, Marx, Preobrazhensky, Neurath, Keynes—to lay the theoretical foundations for his own multi-criterial model.

title: NLR Editors: Michael Burawoy: 1947–2025
summary: The well-travelled life and consistently lucid, radical thought of global labour’s great comparative ethnographer—and social theorist.

title: Michael Burawoy: Palestine through a South African Lens
summary: In a draft text sent to NLR before his tragically early death, the sociologist reflects on the reasons for the starkly different outcomes of Afrikaner and Zionist settler colonialisms: in South Africa, a unified democratic republic, with all its problems; in Israel, ongoing war.

title: Michael Levien: Michael Burawoy
summary: Intellectual reconstruction of the work of Michael Burawoy, from globe-spanning analysis of production regimes—post-colonial, advanced capitalist, state socialist—to theoretical dialogues with Polanyi, Bourdieu and Du Bois.
